newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ENTERTAINMENT PRICES RISE MOST OVER YEAR.
newsitem.headline: ENTERTAINMENT PRICES RISE MOST OVER YEAR.

text.p: Entertainment prices contributed a 22.8 percent increase, the biggest rise of all sectors, to give Estonia a CPI yearly rise of 10.8 percent from July 1996 to July 97, the statistics office said on Thursday.
Transport and communciation prices rose by 14.7 percent and housing costs by 12.9 percent over the last year, the office said in a statement.
The price of food products rose by 4.2 percent.
The unregulated price sector of the economy rose by nine percent and administratively regulated sector prices rose by 13.7 percent over the past year.
